About Champions Park of Newberry
Champions Park of Newberry is one of the premier baseball & softball tournament complexes in the United States today. Attracting more than 42,000 visitors annually for games and tournaments, Champions Park (originally Nations Park) was completed in June 2013 and renamed in May 2014. Located in North Central Florida, Champions Park of Newberry is easily accessible and is conveniently located near Gainesville, Florida. Champions Park has 16 state-of-the-art fields that were built with the player, parent, and family in mind, ensuring that each and every person will have the baseball or softball experience of their dreams.
RADDSports goal is to change the culture of youth sports by promoting and developing the total child through education, discipline, and teaching proper techniques of each sport.
Our Fields
Fewer Rainouts with state-of-the-art A-Turf infields.
All fields are lit
Fields are convertible from 70' fields to smaller diamonds
Play up to 16 games simultaneously
No travel in between tournament games
Covered and enclosed concrete dugouts
Our Amenities
Covered and semi-enclosed spectator viewing areas
8 Batting Cages
Scoreboards for each field
Observation towers for coaches, scouts & recruiters
Access to open areas for pre-game and batting practices
Full Service concessions and bathrooms at each quad
Optional on-site air conditioned administration building for Tournament Director, Team Check-In and Officials
The Extras!
Tournament Merchandise
Baseball and Softball Vendor Merchandise
Optional on-site instructions from professional coaches
Easy accessible parking to field walkways
Certified umpires included
